flavorRadar.title: Flavor Radar

status.preview: Preview updates as you adjust scores.

flavorRadar.referenceImage: Reference image can be shown here.

intensityScale.title: Intensity Scale
intensityScale.description: Enter the intensity of each attribute (0–10). Values with star are calculated.

tooltips.cacao: Typical cocoa flavor reflects well-fermented, properly roasted beans without defects. Evaluate if the sample matches this profile or shows limited fermentation or Criollo characteristics.
tooltips.bitterness: Basic bitterness found in ingredients like coffee, grapefruit, or cola nut. Assess if the intensity contributes to balance or interferes with the overall profile.
tooltips.astringency: Produces a drying or velvety mouthfeel, typical of tannins, raw nut skins, or green banana. Evaluate whether it enhances definition or disrupts the overall profile.
tooltips.roastDegree: The roasting level directly influences sensory expression. Evaluate whether it enhances or distorts the sample's attributes.
tooltips.acidityTotal: Sum the sub-attributes and limit the maximum score to 10. Includes fruity, acetic, lactic, and mineral/butyric notes.
tooltips.freshFruitTotal: Sum of sub-attributes capped at 10. Includes berries, citrus, dark fruits, yellow/orange/white flesh, and tropical fruits.
tooltips.brownFruitTotal: Sum of sub-attributes capped at 10. Includes dried, brown, and overripe fruit notes.
tooltips.vegetalTotal: Sum of sub-attributes capped at 10. Includes grass/herbs, earthy, mushroom, and moss/forest notes.
tooltips.floralTotal: Sum of sub-attributes capped at 10. Includes orange blossom and other flower notes.
tooltips.woodTotal: Sum of sub-attributes capped at 10. Includes light wood, dark wood, and resin notes.
tooltips.spiceTotal: Sum of sub-attributes capped at 10. Includes spices, tobacco, and umami notes.
tooltips.nutTotal: Sum of sub-attributes capped at 10. Includes nut kernel and nut skin notes.
tooltips.caramelPanela: Aromas reminiscent of caramel, brown sugar, and unrefined cane sugar (panela).
tooltips.defectsTotal: Sum of all defect sub-attributes capped at 10. Scores ≥7 result in disqualification; scores 3-6 apply proportional penalties.

subAttributes.frutal: Citric or other fruit acids that add brightness and freshness.
subAttributes.acetic: Vinegar notes, detectable in aroma. Can indicate fermentation issues if too strong.
subAttributes.lactic: Typical of sour milk or yogurt. Adds creamy, tangy notes.
subAttributes.mineralButyric: Metallic (mineral) or rancid butter (butyric) notes. Can be undesirable if too pronounced.
subAttributes.berries: Red/black currant, strawberry, raspberry, blackberry, acai. Bright, fresh berry notes.
subAttributes.citrus: Orange, lemon, lime, grapefruit, or generic citrus notes. Adds zesty freshness.
subAttributes.dark: Cherry, plum. Deep, rich fruit notes.
subAttributes.yellowPulp: Apricot, peach, pear, banana. Soft, sweet fruit notes with yellow/orange/white flesh.
subAttributes.tropical: Passion fruit, pineapple, mango, soursop. Exotic, vibrant fruit notes.
subAttributes.dry: Dried apricot, banana, yellow raisin, non-sulfured dried fig. Concentrated, sweet dried fruit notes.
subAttributes.brown: Dark raisins, dates, prunes. Deep, caramelized dried fruit notes.
subAttributes.overripe: Overly mature fruit, brown inside/outside. Can indicate fermentation issues.
subAttributes.grassHerb: Freshly cut grass, young leaves, hay, dried herbs, thyme, rosemary. Green, herbaceous notes.
subAttributes.earthy: Wet soil smell after rain. Can add complexity or indicate under-fermentation.
subAttributes.mushroom: Fresh mushroom aroma. Earthy, umami notes.
subAttributes.mossForest: Damp moss, forest floor leaves and wood. Deep, earthy forest notes.
subAttributes.orangeBlossom: Orange blossom or orange flower. Delicate, sweet floral notes.
subAttributes.flowers: Jasmine, honeysuckle, rose, lilac, lilies. Various floral notes that add elegance.
subAttributes.light: Freshly cut cocoa, pine, maple, popsicle-stick wood. Light, fresh wood notes.
subAttributes.woodDark: Oak, walnut, teak, mahogany. Deep, rich wood notes.
subAttributes.resin: Pine or other resinous wood. Can add complexity or be overpowering.
subAttributes.spices: Dried coconut, nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves, cacao mass, tonka, vanilla, black pepper. Warm spice notes.
subAttributes.tobacco: Dried tobacco leaves. Can add complexity and depth.
subAttributes.umami: Monosodium glutamate, umami flavor. Savory, seasoned notes.
subAttributes.kernel: Lightly roasted edible nuts such as hazelnut, macadamia, pecan, walnut, cashew, almond, Brazil nut. Inner nut meat.
subAttributes.skin: Lightly roasted shells of nuts. Can add astringency and complexity.
subAttributes.dirty: Off-flavors not related to texture. Dusty, unclean notes indicating poor handling or storage.
subAttributes.animal: Cured meat, ham, melted fat, barnyard, or old leather. Indicates fermentation or storage issues.
subAttributes.rotten: Decomposing plant material or animal manure. Severe defect indicating poor fermentation or contamination.
subAttributes.smoke: Contamination by any smoke. Can overpower other flavors.
subAttributes.humid: Old, wet, moldy, decomposed notes. Indicates poor storage conditions.
subAttributes.moldy: Characteristic of mold growth. Serious defect indicating contamination.
subAttributes.other: Rancid, diesel, petroleum, tar, paint, tires, chemicals, burnt. Various severe defects.
subAttributes.excessiveAstringency: Unwanted Astringency: Evaluate whether the astringency interferes with flavor appreciation, lingers uncomfortably, or dominates the sensory profile. Do not confuse it with mild or structural astringency, which may be acceptable.
subAttributes.unbalancedBitterness: Unwanted Bitterness: Determine whether the bitterness is aggressive, sharp, or unpleasant, and whether it negatively impacts the overall product experience. Do not penalize if the bitterness is integrated and adds complexity.

defects.title: Off-Flavors / Defects (Total = sum)
defects.note: Note: The defects total is a sum, not an average.

contestCleanup.pageDescription: Manage and cleanup expired contest data to maintain database performance and organization.
contestCleanup.title: Contest Data Cleanup
contestCleanup.description: Remove expired contests and their associated data (samples, rankings, evaluations)

whatHappens.title: What happens during cleanup?
whatHappens.item1: Contests with end_date in the past are identified
whatHappens.item2: All samples associated with expired contests are deleted
whatHappens.item3: All rankings for expired contests are removed
whatHappens.item4: The expired contest records are deleted

confirm.title: Are you sure?
confirm.description: This action will permanently delete all expired contests and their associated data. This cannot be undone.

contestCleanup.adminOnly: This action is only available to administrators

success.title: Cleanup Successful
success.description: Expired contests and their data have been removed.

error.title: Cleanup Failed
error.description: Failed to cleanup expired contests. Please try again.

info.title: Important Information
info.item1: Only contests with end_date in the past will be affected
info.item2: All associated data (samples, evaluations, rankings) will be permanently deleted
info.item3: This action cannot be undone - consider backing up data before cleanup
info.item4: Active contests (within start_date and end_date) are never affected
info.item5: Regular cleanup helps maintain optimal database performance

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
bestPractices.item1: Run cleanup after contest results have been archived or exported
bestPractices.item2: Schedule regular cleanups (e.g., monthly or quarterly)
bestPractices.item3: Notify directors before cleaning up their expired contests
bestPractices.item4: Keep a backup of important contest data before cleanup
